column1: Most urinary tract infections (UTIs) are caused by bacteria that enter the urethra and travel to the bladder.
Most often the infection occurs in the bladder itself.
Antibiotics may cause side effects, such as nausea or vomiting, diarrhea, and other symptoms.
Your provider may also give you a drug to relieve the burning pain and urgent need to urinate.
BATHING AND HYGIENE To prevent future urinary tract infections, you should: - Choose sanitary pads instead of tampons, which some doctors believe make infections more likely.
RECURRING INFECTIONS Some women have repeated bladder infections.
- Take a single, daily dose of an antibiotic to prevent infections.
